metadata.title: CVE-2019-11757 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When following the value's prototype chain, it was possible to retain a reference to a locale, delete it, and subsequently reference it. This resulted in a use-after-free and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 70, Thunderbird < 68.2, and Firefox ESR < 68.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11757` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1').
